intro: Acmispon intricatus, commonly known as the curled needlepod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant produces intricate, spiraled seed pods that curl as they mature. Acmispon intricatus is often found in rocky soils and is considered a valuable component of local biodiversity.
